websites.name: Marxists Internet Archive
websites.description: The largest communist archive in the world, containing works by pretty much everyone who ever called themselves a communist (and some who definitely didn't). Founded in the 1990s, it provides completely uncensored texts and proceedings.

websites.name: leftove.rs
websites.description: An archive focusing on 'left-leaning' political movements that are often overlooked, including communist movements. Notable for mostly hosting scans, thus preserving the aesthetic tone of the works they shared.

websites.name: Internationalist Communist Tendency
websites.description: Formed in 2009 from the International Bureau for a Revolutionary Party, a previous reconciliation of the Communist Workers' Organization (UK) and the Internationalist Communist Party. It is thus the heir to the 'original' party of the 'Italian' Communist Left. One of the largest organizations of the Communist Left in the world due to its affiliated groups, it is well-known for its anti-unionist stance.

websites.name: Endnotes
websites.description: The biggest journal in the tendency of Communization.

websites.name: MEGAdigital
websites.description: Digital parts of the Marx-Engels Complete Edition, in German.

websites.name: Bureau of Public Secrets
websites.description: Translations of works by the Situationist International to English, along with additional articles.

websites.name: IntCP (The International Communist)
websites.description: One of the claimants to the International Communist Party name, and likely the largest among the ICPs. The group is comprised of the former majority of Il Partito, and split from it in 2024 after a wave of expulsions.

websites.name: Ruthless Criticism
websites.description: A collection of translations and original articles, separated into topics.

websites.name: Balance y Avante
websites.description: Spanish group that originated from former disparate militants of Il Partito.

websites.name: Council Communist Collective
websites.description: An attempt to unify those who adhere to council communism. Founded in 2023.

websites.name: Quinterna / n+1
websites.description: One of the main working groups focused in the interaction of revolutionary communism with today's scientific environment. Via QuinternaLab, it hosts meetings and coordinates collective work.

websites.name: ICP (Il Partito)
websites.description: One of the claimants to the International Communist Party name, born from Il Programma's implosion in the 1970s-80s, after its Florence section was expelled in 1973.

websites.name: ICP (Il Programma)
websites.description: One of the claimaints to the International Communist Party name, born from a split in the PCInt (Internationalist Communist Party) in 1952.

websites.name: ICP (Le Prolétaire)
websites.description: One of the claimants to the International Communist Party name, split from Il Programma in 1982.

websites.name: ICP (El Comunista)
websites.description: Not to be confused with the Le Prolétaire, which publishes 'Il Comunista'. One of the claimants to the International Communist Party name, born from Il Programma's implosion in the 1970s-80s, split circa 1983.

websites.name: Grupo Barbaria
websites.description: The biggest organization of the 'Italian' Communist Left in Spain, and the one which most 'new-wave' left-communist organizations in Europe orbit around.

websites.name: Communia
websites.description: Spanish and English-language Marxist blog focusing on Spain.

websites.name: Controverses
websites.description: A communist website mostly consisting of the internal proceedings of the 'Italian' Communist Left. Supposedly split from the ICC, timeframe uncertain.

websites.name: Solar Collective
websites.description: Workgroup founded in 2024. Emphasizes organic centralism.

websites.name: Revolutionary Technical Collective
websites.description: A technical communist workgroup founded in 2022, today mostly reserved to maintaining pages of the Communist Left.

websites.name: International Communist Current
websites.description: Formed in 1975. Mostly French, they are well-known proponents of the position that global capitalism has been in a managed crisis since the First World War.

websites.name: International Group of the Communist Left
websites.description: Communist group founded in 2013.

websites.name: La Sinistra Internazionale
websites.description: Small left-communist party in Italy.

websites.name: Groupe Communiste Mondial
websites.description: A now-defunct group, split from Invariance circa 1969.

websites.name: Internationalist Communist Perspective
websites.description: Korean left-communist grouping, publishes articles in English and Korean.

websites.name: GegenStandpunkt
websites.description: An influential post-maoist publication in Germany, included due to its influence in some contemporary critiques by the Communist Left. Also publishes in other languages.

websites.name: Counseling Communism
websites.description: A council communist study circle founded in 2020.

websites.name: Workers' Voice
websites.description: Dutch publication aligned with council communism.

websites.name: Materiales X La Emancipacion
websites.description: Spanish-language publication mostly aligned with council communism.

websites.name: Left Wing Communism
websites.description: An archive with various texts, mainly of the german-dutch tendency of left-wing communism.

websites.name: Paul Mattick Homepage
websites.description: Defunct archive of various texts by Paul Mattick.

websites.name: Riff-Raff
websites.description: Defunct swedish left-communist group.

websites.name: Antonie Pannekoek Archives
websites.description: Archive of council communist literature.

websites.name: Root And Branch Archives
websites.description: Defunct archive about Root and Branch, a small group associated with Paul Mattick, Jr.

websites.name: Kurasje
websites.description: Defunct council communist archive.

websites.name: Arbertarmakt
websites.description: Defunct council communist archive.

websites.name: Internationalist Perspective
websites.description: Split from the ICC in 1986. Today, it mainly functions as a communist publication.

websites.name: För Kommunism
websites.description: Long defunct swedish left-communist group.

websites.name: Le Prolétariat Universel
websites.description: A page with interviews and historic texts of the left-communist tradition.

websites.name: Troploin
websites.description: A publication in the tendency of Communization. Publishes in both French and English.

websites.name: Viewpoint Magazine
websites.description: Broad-spectrum marxist publication, inquiry and study group.

websites.name: Sojourner Truth Organization Archive
websites.description: Archive of pamphlets and publications by the Sojourner Truth Organization, an anti-racist autonomist group in the US.

websites.name: Revue Matériaux Critiques
websites.description: Left-communist publication which publishes in French, English, and Spanish.

websites.name: Zerowork
websites.description: Archive of works from a collective and journal named around their support for the concept of 'laziness' as a means of insubordination. Features many writings by Harry Cleaver, and was influential within its niche.

websites.name: workerscontrol.net
websites.description: An archive of various works broadly aligned with autonomism and the communist dissidence.

websites.name: Hic Salta - Communisation
websites.description: A Spanish communization blog with autonomist influences.

websites.name: Blaumachen
websites.description: A multilingual blog, with influences of autonomia and communization.

websites.name: Big Flame Archive
websites.description: Archives of a 'libertarian'/autonomist class organization that existed in East London, known for running a 'Claimants Union' focused around those on unemployment benefits in the UK.

websites.name: Global Women's Strike
websites.description: The main grouping behind the Wages For Housework movement.

websites.name: Notes From Below
websites.description: A workers' inquiry group.

websites.name: Angry Workers of the World
websites.description: Organization with autonomist leanings.

websites.name: Internationale Situationniste in English
websites.description: English translations of Situationist works.

websites.name: News and Letters Committees
websites.description: A Marxist-Humanist group in the US, which publishes the 'News & Letters' periodical. Founded in 1955, it warrants inclusion in this list due to its influence on stronger dissident positions.

websites.name: Marxist-Humanist Initiative
websites.description: A large splinter of the News and Letters Committees which claims to maintain consistency with its previous positions. Founded in 2009.

websites.name: The International Marxist-Humanist
websites.description: A Marxist-Humanist journal with an academic bent. Included in this list for its importance to contemporary discourse.

websites.name: Ruthless Criticism (2020, Brazil)
websites.description: Brazilian councilist publication, publishes translations, critiques, and original texts.

websites.name: Red Thread
websites.description: Brazilian publication focused around translating works of the Communist Left to portuguese.

websites.name: Coletivo Ruptura
websites.description: Portuguese communist group. Has a modest presence within that country's Communist Left.
